alert.note: Alert for Mills (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 26 at 6:22PM CDT until April 26 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR EAST CENTRAL MILLS COUNTY... At 620 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located just east of Goldthwaite, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and two inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. The potentially tornadic ciculation is now east of the city of Goldthwaite. This circulation will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Mills County, including Center City and Star. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter now! Get to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building and avoid windows.
